conclusion: Calculate the electric field strength at point A due to charges 2q and -q.
Charges 2q and -q are at two vertices of a cube with side length L. Point A is another vertex.
Midpoint O is the midpoint of the line connecting charges 2q and -q.
Distance from each charge to midpoint O is L/2.
Electric field due to a point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r^2.
Electric field at O due to 2q is 8kq/L^2.
Electric field at O due to -q is -4kq/L^2.
Net electric field at O is 4kq/L^2.
Magnitude of electric field at O is E.
Distance from each charge to point A is Lâˆš3.
Electric field at A due to 2q is 2kq/3L^2.
Electric field at A due to -q is -kq/3L^2.
Net electric field at A is kq/3L^2.
Substitute kq into expression for E_A: E_A = E/12.
Magnitude of electric field strength at point A is E/12.
